Box office gross values of ₹600–675 crore were reported for Kabali in the first 13 days by several organisations including Financial Express and Indian Express,[54][55] which were more than double the estimates made by other sources.[56]International Business Times (IBT) and Firstpost criticized these estimates as inflated, explaining the discrepancy as due in part to the addition of "pre-release business" figures, such as music and satellite rights sales of ₹200 crore,[57] being factored into the box office sales totals.[56]Firstpost wrote, "More conservative estimates put Kabali’s collections at around Rs 300 crores from worldwide ticket sales."[57] IBT's analysts in August 2016 estimated the film's worldwide gross total of its first 13 days at around ₹3.5 billion (US$49 million).[58]
Figures given in December 2016 by Financial Express indicated an estimated domestic gross of ₹215 crore and an international gross of ₹262 crore, which total ₹477 crore.[59] A figure of USD$77 million given by Forbes in May 2017 converted to approximately ₹493–499 crore.[60] According to International Business Times in October 2017, Kabali's final worldwide gross was around ₹286 crore (US$40 million).[61]
